Dickite.label: Dickite
Dickite.description: Dickite is a phyllosilicate clay mineral chemically composed of aluminium, silicon, hydrogen and oxygen contributing 20.90%, 21.76%, 1.56%, and 55.78% each respectively. Wikipedia

Nontronite.label: Nontronite
Nontronite.description: Nontronite is the iron rich member of the smectite group of clay minerals. Nontronites typically have a chemical composition consisting of more than ~30% Fe2O3 and less than ~12% Al2O3. Wikipedia

Phillipsite.label: Phillipsite
Phillipsite.description: Phillipsite is a mineral series of the zeolite group; a hydrated potassium, calcium and aluminium silicate, approximating to (Ca,Na2,K2)3Al6Si10O32·12H2O. The members of the series are phillipsite-K, phillipsite-Na and phillipsite-Ca. Wikipedia

Paragonite.label: Paragonite
Paragonite.description: Paragonite, also known as Natron-Glimmer, is a mineral, related to muscovite. Its empirical formula is NaAl2[(OH)2|AlSi3O10]. Wikipedia

Sapphirine.label: Sapphirine
Sapphirine.description: Sapphirine is a rare mineral, a silicate of magnesium and aluminium with the chemical formula (Mg,Al)8(Al,Si)6O20. Wikipedia

Tridymite.label: Tridymite
Tridymite.description: Tridymite is a high-temperature polymorph of quartz and usually occurs as minute tabular white or colorless pseudo-hexagonal crystals, or scales, in cavities in felsic volcanic rocks. Its chemical formula is SiO2. Wikipedia

Tschermakite.label: Tschermakite
Tschermakite.description: The endmember hornblende tschermakite is a calcium rich monoclinic amphibole mineral. It is frequently synthesized along with its ternary solid solution series members tremolite and cummingtonite so ... Wikipedia

Tugtupite.label: Tugtupite
Tugtupite.description: Tugtupite is a rare beryllium aluminium tectosilicate. It also contains sodium and chlorine and has the formula Na4AlBeSi4O12Cl. Tugtupite is a member of the silica deficient feldspathoid mineral group. Wikipedia

Struvite.label: Struvite
Struvite.description: Struvite is a phosphate mineral with formula NH4MgPO4·6H2O. Struvite crystallizes in the orthorhombic system as white to yellowish or brownish-white pyramidal crystals or in platey mica-like forms. Wikipedia

Wakefieldite.label: Wakefieldite
Wakefieldite.description: Wakefieldite is an uncommon rare earth element vanadate mineral. There are four main types of wakefieldite- wakefieldite-, wakefieldite-, wakefieldite-, and wakefieldite-, depending upon the dominant rare earth metal ion present. Wikipedia

Fornacite.label: Fornacite
Fornacite.description: Fornacite is a rare lead, copper chromate arsenate hydroxide mineral with the formula Pb2Cu. It forms a series with the phosphate mineral vauquelinite. Wikipedia

Lanarkite.label: Lanarkite
Lanarkite.description: Lanarkite is a mineral, a form of lead sulfate with formula Pb2O. It was originally found at Leadhills in the Scottish county of Lanarkshire, hence the name. Wikipedia

Troilite.label: Troilite
Troilite.description: Troilite is a rare iron sulfide mineral with the simple formula of FeS. It is the iron rich endmember of the pyrrhotite group. Pyrrhotite has the formula FeS which is iron deficient. Wikipedia

Stishovite.label: Stishovite
Stishovite.description: Stishovite is an extremely hard, dense tetragonal form of silicon dioxide. It is very rare on the earth's surface. It may however be a predominant form of silicon dioxide in the earth, especially in the lower mantle. Wikipedia

Fluor-liddicoatite.label: Fluor-liddicoatite
Fluor-liddicoatite.description: Fluor-liddicoatite is a rare member of the tourmaline group of minerals, elbaite subgroup, and the theoretical calcium endmember of the elbaite-fluor-liddicoatite series; the pure end-member has not yet been found in nature. Wikipedia

Meridianiite.label: Meridianiite
Meridianiite.description: Meridianiite — MgSO4•11H2O — is the crystalline 11-hydrate magnesium sulfate phase that precipitates from solutions saturated in Mg2+ and SO42- ions at temperatures less than 2 ˚C. Clear to colorless, it is a ... Wikipedia

Meteoric iron.label: Meteoric iron
Meteoric iron.description: Meteoric iron is a native metal found in meteorites and made from the elements iron and nickel mainly in the form of the mineral phases kamacite and taenite. Meteoric iron makes up the bulk of iron meteorites but is also found in other meteorites. Wikipedia

Hessonite.label: Grossular
Hessonite.description: Grossular or grossularite is a calcium-aluminium mineral species of the garnet gemstone group with the formula Ca3Al2(SiO4)3, though the calcium may in part be replaced by ferrous iron and the aluminium by ferric iron. Wikipedia

Autunite.label: Autunite
Autunite.description: Autunite with formula Ca(UO2)2(PO4)2·10-12H2O is a yellow - greenish fluorescent mineral with a hardness of 2 - 2½. Autunite crystallizes in the orthorhombic system and often occurs as tabular square crystals. Wikipedia

Safflorite.label: Safflorite
Safflorite.description: Safflorite is a rare cobalt iron arsenide mineral with formula As2. Pure safflorite would be just CoAs2, but iron is virtually always present. Wikipedia

Schreibersite.label: Schreibersite
Schreibersite.description: Schreibersite is generally a rare iron nickel phosphide mineral, (Fe,Ni)3P, though common in iron-nickel meteorites. The only known occurrence of the mineral on Earth is located on Disko Island in Greenland. Wikipedia

Spodumene.label: Spodumene
Spodumene.description: Spodumene is a pyroxene mineral consisting of lithium aluminium inosilicate, LiAl(SiO3)2, and is a source of lithium. Wikipedia

Abelsonite.label: Abelsonite
Abelsonite.description: Abelsonite is a nickel porphyrin mineral with formula C31H32N4Ni. It was discovered in 1969 in the U.S. State of Utah and described in 1975. The mineral is named after geochemist Philip H. Abelson. It is the only known crystalline geoporphyrin. Wikipedia

Aenigmatite.label: Aenigmatite
Aenigmatite.description: Aenigmatite, also known as Cossyrite after Cossyra, the ancient name of Pantelleria, is a sodium, iron, titanium inosilicate mineral. Wikipedia

Allabogdanite.label: Allabogdanite
Allabogdanite.description: Allabogdanite is a very rare phosphide mineral with formula (Fe,Ni)2P, found in 1997 in a meteorite. Wikipedia

Armalcolite.label: Armalcolite
Armalcolite.description: Armalcolite is a titanium-rich mineral with the chemical formula Ti2O5. It was first found at Tranquility Base on the Moon in 1969 and named for Armstrong, Aldrin and Collins, the three Apollo 11 astronauts. Wikipedia

Celadonite.label: Celadonite
Celadonite.description: Celadonite is a mica group mineral, a phyllosilicate of potassium, iron in both oxidation states, aluminium and hydroxide with formula K[Si4O10](OH)2. Wikipedia

Cerite.label: Cerite
Cerite.description: Cerite is a complex silicate mineral group containing cerium, formula (Ce,La,Ca)9(SiO4)6(OH)3. The cerium and lanthanum content varies with the Ce rich species and the La rich species. Wikipedia
